message.content:
cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.CG, cs.CVPR, cs.GRAPHICS

Reasoning: The paper presents a novel algorithm for light source estimation in scenes reconstructed with a RGB-D camera. The algorithm uses path-tracing and analytical derivatives of the light transport equation to perform gradient descent and minimize photometric error. This involves techniques from computer graphics (path-tracing, environment map parameterization), computer vision (photometric error minimization), and optimization (gradient descent). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.GR (Computer Graphics), followed by cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.CG (Computational Geometry). The paper also uses techniques from the field of computer vision and graphics, which suggests that it could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.CVPR (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.GRAPHICS (Graphics).
